title: 1953 Iranian parliamentary dissolution referendum
text:
A referendum on the <a href="Dissolution%20of%20parliament">dissolution</a> of <a href="Parliament%20of%20Iran">Parliament</a>, the first <a href="referendum">referendum</a> ever held in <a href="Iran">Iran</a>, was held in August 1953. The dissolution was approved by more than 99% of voters.
Following the referendum, there were talks about another referendum to abolish the <a href="Pahlavi%20dynasty">Pahlavi dynasty</a> and make Iran a <a href="republic">republic</a>, however the government was overthrown by a <a href="1953%20Iranian%20coup%20d%27%C3%A9tat">coup d'état</a> shortly after.
Conduct.
The balloting was not secret and there were two separate voting booths, i.e. the opponents of Mossadegh had to cast their vote in a separate tent. Critics pointed that the referendum had ignored the democratic demand for <a href="secret%20ballot">secret ballot</a>s.
